thread.title: Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being No 1 keeper
thread.title_full: Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being No 1 keeper

author: smorgan
title: Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being No 1 keeper
text:
Willy or won't he? Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being No 1 keeper 
Pep Guardiola is set to offer goalie, who is out of contract in the summer, a new 12-month deal By Martin Blackburn Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments WILLY CABALLERO is in no rush for a new deal at Manchester City despite being the club’s No  1. 
The keeper, who saved a penalty in Tuesday’s 5-3 Champions League win over Monaco , is out of contract this summer. News Group Newspapers Ltd Willy Caballero is in no rush to commit his future to Manchester City 
City are set to offer him a 12-month deal. 
But Caballero, 35, fears becoming a back-up again with Pep Guardiola keen on Benfica’s Ederson Moraes . 
The Argie is keeping Claudio Bravo out but he said: “I can’t think about next season — I just think about playing now. 
“I am enjoying being No 1. I will do my best to stay there and see what happens.” PA:Press Association Pep Guardiola will have to sweat over Willy Caballero’s future PA:Press Association Willy Caballero saves a penalty from Radamel Falcao in the Champions League clash against Monaco PA:Press Association Claudio Bravo’s high’profile move to Man City has so far backfired Etihad rocking after Manchester City comeback against Monaco in the Champions League Related stories Europa League round-up Lyon thrash AZ Alkmaar 7-1 while a Pope-inspired Villarreal beat Roma 1-0... but lose on agg in the hat When is the Europa League last 16 draw? Man Utd are the only English team left - all you need to know Brand new striker Eric has a shock in store for Nick over the latest blackmail scandal NEIL CUSTIS Wayne Rooney may have turned down China move but his Man United days are numbered... and the statement told you something was up STAN-D AND DELIVER Time is sadly running out to organise a salute to Queens Park Rangers legend and Alzheimer's sufferer Stan Bowles 'We were stupid' Christian Eriksen blasts Spurs' display against Gent despite Mauricio Pochettino saying he's 'proud' Bon appetit Man City and Chelsea on red alert after £50m-rated Leonardo Bonucci falls out with Juventus boss Max Allegri SNARLING FOXES Sacked Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri is furious after being 'betrayed by players and board' Neil Ashton Leicester flops who cost Claudio Ranieri his job deserve to lose their Prem title medals LUIZ IS STILL IN KNEE-D David Luiz needs treatment for rest of season following Sergio Aguero horror tackle in November Not a Red Ajax wonderkid Daishawn Redan confirms he will reject Manchester United and sign a new deal Great Ex-spec-tations Bournemouth players told to wear ORANGE GLASSES before they go to bed in bid to sleep better 
Caballero has forced error-prone former Barcelona keeper Claudio Bravo out of first team considerations. 
Guardiola brought in his former Nou Camp keeper to replace Joe Hart but failed to convince between the sticks. 
In fact, he has been so bad, that research by SmartBets showed of all the keepers who have played at least ten games this season, no-one had a lower saves-per-goal record .
